label: 二重織物
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Double-patterned silk was a type of brocaded damask in which long floats of auxiliary brocading wefts formed superimposed figures on a ground weave of warp-faced twill with weft-float patterning (p. 782). [HW]
